A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed assailants in Barangay Soledad, Santa Rosa, Nueva Ecija on 2 November 2019.

On 2 November 2019, a suspected NPA militant was killed and another was wounded and then captured in a firefight with the military in Barangay San Isidro, Santiago, Agusan del Norte. The military reported retrieving weapons and other items after the clash.

Two drug suspects who were also private security officers were killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Mining, Angeles, Pampanga on 3 November 2019. No police officers were wounded during the shootout.

On 3 November 2019, a private security officer of a store was shot dead while another employee was wounded in an attack at the store in Barangay Cutcut, Angeles City, Pampanga, carried out by other private security officers who the police later identified as drug suspects. It was not clear if the three private security officers - assailants and fatality - were all part of the same private security firm or had the same assignments.

On 3 November 2019, government forces and suspected NPA militants exchanged gunfire in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Lim-ao, Hinabangan, Samar. The military reported no casualties on their side and an undetermined number on the rebel side. The military also reported retrieving weapons.

On 3 November 2019, government forces and suspected NPA militants exchanged gunfire in a 5-minute firefight in Rosario, Agusan del Sur. The military reported no casualties on their side and an undetermined number on the rebel side. The military also reported retrieving weapons.

On 3 November 2019, NPA militants and government forces engaged in a 15-minute firefight in Barangay Cagsiay 2, Mauban, Quezon. The military reported arresting an NPA militant as well as retrieving weapons and other items during the follow-up operations.

On 3 November 2019, government forces and about 10 suspected NPA militants engaged in a 40-minute firefight in Barangay Antol, Calbiga, Samar. The military reported two wounded on the government side and an undetermined number on the rebel side.

source: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News
notes: On 3 November 2019, a government soldier was killed in an explosion of an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Santa Rosa, Lopez, Quezon.

assoc_actor_2: Makabayan: Patriotic Coalition of the People; Farmers (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines)

The victim was also an organizer of Makabayan Southern Tagalog, among his other affiliations. The victim had previously been arrested in October 2010 and detained on accusations of membership in the NPA, though he was released after five years after a court dismissed the charges.

assoc_actor_1: BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On 4 November 2019, close to 25 demonstrators led by BAYAN-Panay and KARAPATAN demonstrated in front of the Police Regional Office of Western Visayas at Camp Martin Delgado, Fort San Pedro, Iloilo City, to decry the 31 October arrest of close to 60 individuals affiliated with red-tagged organizations in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The arrests had been carried out on charges of illegal possession of firearms and explosives, though the organizations concerned said that the evidence was planted. The arrests were defended by authorities as a legitimate operation with the necessary arrest warrants, but were condemned by national and international organizations as a crackdown on leftist groups. The arrests in Bacolod had been carried out on charges of illegal possession of firearms and explosives, though the organizations concerned said that the evidence was planted. The arrests were defended by authorities as a legitimate operation with the necessary arrest warrants, but were condemned by national and international organizations as a crackdown on leftist groups. A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in San Andres Bukid, Manila on 5 November 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Canlubang, Calamba, Laguna on 5 November 2019.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Gaya-gaya, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 5 November 2019.

A drug suspect was shot dead while another was wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Bagong Silangan, Quezon City on 5 November 2019. The survivor of the attack claimed that he and his killed companion were not drug users nor pushers, but police assets who were cooperating with the police. However, the police said that the fatality was part of the barangay's drug watchlist.

source: CNN; Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News
notes: On 5 November 2019, three suspected Abu Sayyaf militants were killed in a five-minute firefight with government troops from the 41st Infantry Division and 1102nd Infantry Brigade in Barangay Kan Islam, Indanan, Sulu. The three ASG militants- one Filipino and two Egyptians - were suspected of planning to carry out a suicide attack, since they were carrying vests with explosives and triggering devices on their way to Jolo, Sulu when they were flagged down by the government soldiers. The military also reported retrieving weapons from the fatalities after the firefight.

source: Philippine News Agency; Cebu Daily News
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Basak, Zamboanguita, Negros Oriental on 5 November 2019.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants along a highway in Opol, Misamis Oriental on 5 November 2019.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay 2, San Jose, Oriental Mindoro on 5 November 2019.

On 5 November 2019, a regional trial court judge was shot dead by unidentified armed assailants in Barangay Mameltac, San Fernando, La Union. The victim had acquitted a suspected NPA rebel of murder the previous month.

On 5 November 2019, 16 pipe bombs suspected of being prepared for suicide bombers were retrieved by government troops when they arrested an Abu Sayyaf militant in Paligue, Indanan, Sulu. The arrest of the Abu Sayyaf militant and the recovery of the bombs came a few hours after an encounter between the military and would-be Abu Sayyaf suicide bombers in the same town.
On 6 November 2019, 24 NPA rebels and members of NPA-affiliated groups surrendered to the military in San Luis, Aurora.
On 6 November 2019, 53 NPA rebels and members of NPA-affiliated groups surrendered to the military in Carranglan, Nueva Ecija.

On 6 November 2019, a provincial government employee assigned to the Provincial Security Unit was shot dead by unidentified assailants at the corner of General Santos Drive and Arellano Street in Koronadal City, South Cotabato.

source: Manila Times; Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 6 November 2019, a suspected NPA militant who was also a village chief was killed in a clash with patrolling police officers in Barangay San Antonio, Milagros, Masbate. The military reported retrieving weapons and other items after the clash.

source: Manila Times; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Amnesty International; Sunstar (Philippines); Rappler; AFP; ABS CBN; CNN
notes: On 6 November 2019, top drug war critic Vice President Leni Robredo, during a press conference at her office in Quezon City, formally accepted President Rodrigo Duterte's appointment of her as co-chair of the Inter-Agency Committee on Anti-Illegal Drugs (ICAD), a position she would share with the director-general of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA). The development came a day after the president's appointment of Robredo was officially announced in Manila, following days of heated exchanges between their two camps, where the president dared the vice president to do better than the administration in the implementation of the drug war. In their preceding tit-for-tat, Duterte had said he would give the 'drug czar' position to Robredo for a couple of months, in which time she would have 'full powers' over the drug war. Robredo's allies in the opposition cautioned her against taking the post, saying she was being set up for failure and that she would be made a scapegoat, but she ultimately took the post, saying she would use the opportunity to put an end to the 'senseless' drug war killings. Robredo's appointment papers set 30 June 2022 as the end of her new post's term.

On 6 November 2019, the Bacolod City Prosecutor's Office ordered the release of 31 of the 42 adults who were part of the 56 arrested by the police in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental on 31 October. The 56 individuals were affiliated with different red-tagged organizations and were arrested in simultaneous police operations across Bacolod City on the said date. The Prosecutor's Office found no sufficient basis for the arrest of the 31, who were reportedly merely present at the raided offices when the police operations took place.

assoc_actor_1: KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On 6 November 2019, different groups including KARAPATAN demonstrated in front of the Hall of Justice in Quezon City, in order to denounce the issuance of 'patently baseless search warrants' by a judge of the city that led to the October 31 arrest of close to 60 individuals affiliated with red-tagged organizations in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The arrests had been carried out on charges of illegal possession of firearms and explosives, though the organizations concerned said that the evidence was planted. The arrests were defended by authorities as a legitimate operation based on arrest warrants issued by the said Quezon City judge, but were condemned by national and international organizations as a crackdown on leftist groups. Another November 5 raid targeting the office of a red-tagged organization in Manila, which led to the arrest of three more individuals, was also carried out on the basis of a warrant issued by the same judge. [size=no report]
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Babag, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu on 6 November 2019.

The NPA claims that five government soldiers were killed. However, the military disputed this, saying there were no casualties among them and that a number of NPA militants were wounded. Fatalities coded at 0.

On 9 November 2019, four demonstrators and six private security guards were injured when a commotion ensued during a demonstration in front of a factory in Barangay Kalawaan, Pasig City. The private security guards reportedly dispersed the demonstration when its participants pelted them with stones and metal bars. 23 demonstrators were later taken into police custody. Around 50 workers had been demonstrating on site in support of a strike at the factory. [size=around 50]

On 9 November 2019, about 2,700 residents or more than 450 families fled the village of Tukanalipao, Mamasapano, Maguindanao after warring broke out between Islamic State (IS)-inspired militants - identified in conflicting reports as either Dawlah Islamiyah or as the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) - and the military. The residents of Tukanalipao escaped to neighboring villages.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency; BusinessWorld (Philippines); Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine Star
notes: On 9 November 2019, two suspected Islamic State (IS)-inspired militants - identified in conflicting reports as being with either Dawlah Islamiyah or the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) - and a government soldier were killed in a firefight between the militants and government forces in Barangay Tukanalipao, Mamasapano, Maguindanao. According to the military, at least three IS-inspired militants and two government soldiers were also injured.

On 18 November 2019, hundreds of street vendors led by the Metro Manila Vendor Alliance staged a demonstration in front of the City Hall in Quezon City to ask the mayor to suspend sidewalk clearing operations during the December holiday season. On 21 November 2019, a police investigator assigned to the Philippine National Police's Internal Affairs Service died in an ambush by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants near his hotel along Molave Street in Barangay Kamputhaw, Cebu City. The victim previously headed the Cebu Provincial Intelligence Branch, the police intelligence unit in Calbayog City, and was also spokesperson of the Bohol Provincial Police Office. He was reportedly about to meet his wife when the incident took place and is assumed off-duty.

On 22 November 2019, demonstrators led by the Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (BAYAN) chapter in Panay demonstrated outside the police regional headquarters in Camp Delgado, Iloilo City, to decry the supposed targeting of leftist activists and organizations. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SOS: Save Our Schools Network; Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines); Students (Philippines)
notes: On 22 November 2019, students and lumad groups from Mindanao, led by the Save Our Schools Network, staged a demonstration at the University of the Philippines campus in Diliman, Quezon City, to mark the 30th anniversary of the declaration of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. The demonstrators highlighted several issues during the event, including climate change, environmental degradation in Mindanao, and the closure of lumad schools upon government orders. [size=no report]

source: ABS CBN; Sunstar (Philippines); Abante; Cebu Daily News
notes: On 22 November 2019, a suspected NPA militant was killed, another was wounded and arrested, while six others were also arrested in a 1.5-hour firefight with the military in Barangay Cansalungon, Isabela, Negros Occidental. The military reported no casualties.

source: Abante; AP; ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin; Rappler; Xinhua
notes: On 22 November 2019, the alleged liaison of the Islamic State to Abu Sayyaf was killed in a firefight with government troops near Barangays Sandah and Tanum in Patikul, Sulu. Two government soldiers were also reported wounded.

On 22 November 2019, the military captured a camp of the Maute group after an encounter in Madalum, Lanao del Sur. The military reported retrieving tents and other items carrying Islamic State insignia.

On 22 November 2019, a suspected NPA militant was killed while another was wounded in an hour-long firefight with the military in Barangay Cansalungon, Isabela, Negros Occidental. The military reported no casualties.
On 23 November 2019, members of the LGBTQ community demonstrated in Baguio City, Benguet during the city's annual Pride March. [size=no report]

source: GMA News; Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Tempo (Philippines); Philippine News Agency
notes: On 23 November 2019, an Abu Sayyaf militant was killed and four were wounded while five government troops were also wounded during a 45-minute firefight in Barangay Kabbun Takas, Patikul, Sulu. The encounter took place during military operations aimed at rescuing a British coupled kidnapped by the Abu Sayyaf in October.

source: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 23 November 2019, an MILF commander's party was unhurt when an improvised explosive device (IED) planted underneath a motorcycle was remotely detonated by suspected BIFF militants as the commander's pick-up truck passed by the motorcycle in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The commander himself was not in the pick-up truck during the incident. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of a 2014 peace plan with the government. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region.

actor2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: On 23 November 2019, a village watchman was gunned down by an assailant in Imus, Cavite.

assoc_actor_1: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
notes: On 23 November 2019, journalists led by the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines staged a demonstration along Mendiola Street in San Miguel, Manila to mark the 10-year anniversary of the Ampatuan Massacre that happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009. That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers. The demonstrators condemned the slow pace of justice as they anticipated a ruling on the case in the coming weeks. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2019, government troops seized two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and other bomb-making materials at a Dawlah Islamiyah hideout in Barangay Inaladan, Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao. The military said the explosives were intended for an attack on a festival in Midsayap, Cotabato the next day.

On 23 November 2019, relatives of the victims of the Ampatuan Massacre held a vigil and demonstrated in Ampatuan, Maguindanao, to mark the 10-year anniversary of the Ampatuan Massacre. The massacre happened in the said town on 23 November 2009, seeing 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers. The victims' relatives condemned the slow pace of justice as they anticipated a ruling on the case in the coming weeks. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2019, journalists led by the Negros Press Club staged a demonstration at the Marker of the Fallen Journalists at the Public Plaza in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental to mark the 10-year anniversary of the Ampatuan Massacre that happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009. That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers. The demonstrators condemned the slow pace of justice as they anticipated a ruling on the case in the coming weeks. [size=no report]

That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers. The demonstrators condemned the slow pace of justice as they anticipated a ruling on the case in the coming weeks. [size=no report]

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Tempo (Philippines); GMA News; Philippine News Agency; Abante
notes: On 24 November 2019, five Abu Sayyaf militants - including two sub-commanders - were killed while two government troops were wounded during a 30-minute firefight in Indanan, Sulu. The encounter took place during military operations aimed at rescuing a British coupled kidnapped by the Abu Sayyaf in October.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed assailants in Barangay San Pascual, Ubay, Bohol on 24 November 2019.
On 24 November 2019, a mayor's aide was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Urbiztondo, Pangasinan.

source: ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 24 November 2019, a civilian was killed, three others were wounded, while a police officer - the presumed actual target - escaped unscathed as a grenade planted by unidentified assailants under the police officer's motorcycle fell off the motorcycle and detonated in Barangay Addition Hills, Mandaluyong City. The police see drug suspects as the likely perpetrators, given the target's work in anti-illegal drugs operations.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler; Amnesty International; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 24 November 2019, President Rodrigo Roa Duterte fired Vice President Leni Robredo from her position as co-chair of the Inter-Agency Committee on Anti-Illegal Drugs (ICAD), less than three weeks after he appointed her to the position. The development came after continuing heated exchanges between the president's and the vice president's camps after the appointment. Prior to Robredo's appointment, Duterte had said he would give the so-called drug czar position to Robredo for a couple of months, in which time she would have full powers over the drug war. Robredo's allies in the opposition cautioned her against taking the post, saying she was being set up for failure and that she would be made a scapegoat, but she ultimately took the post, saying she would use the opportunity to put an end to what she called senseless drug war killings.

On 24 November 2019, suspected NPA militants and government troops engaged in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. The military reported no casualties on its side while noting that bloodstains at the clash site indicated NPA casualties. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items.

assoc_actor_1: PISTON: Pinagkaisang Samahan ng mga Tsuper at Operator Nationwide; Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: On 25 November 2019, transport groups led by the PISTON affiliate in Bicol staged demonstrations across the region during the first day of a two-day region-wide transport strike, meant to protest the government's public utility vehicle (PUV) modernization program. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2019, two government troops were wounded as suspected NPA militants and the military engaged in a 30-minute firefight in Barangay Ara, Benito Soliven, Isabela. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items. There was an undetermined number of casualties on the rebel side.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bugas, Badian, Cebu on 25 November 2019.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Tempo (Philippines); Manila Times
notes: On 25 November 2019, Abu Sayyaf militants and government troops engaged in a 10-minute firefight between Barangays Silangkan and Kaha in Parang, Sulu, during military operations aimed at rescuing a British coupled kidnapped by the Abu Sayyaf in October. The Abu Sayyaf militants were reportedly overwhelmed and fled, allowing the military to retrieve and rescue the kidnap victims.
On 25 November 2019, a drug suspect was shot dead by five other drug suspects in Barangay Lagtang, Talisay, Cebu.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Hipodromo, Cebu City, Cebu on 26 November 2019.
On 26 November 2019, a village chief was shot dead by unidentified assailants at her home in Barangay Pangao-aoan West, Aringay, La Union.

source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 26 November 2019, three militants of the Islamic State-inspired Dawlah Islamiyah group were killed in their hideout in Barangay Pusao, Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao by artillery fire from government forces. The government was reportedly pursuing Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants when they chanced upon the Dawlah Islamiyah members. Dawlah Islamiya and BIFF often work together. Some conflicting reports instead identified the fatalities as BIFF militants.
On 26 November 2019, a village councilor was wounded while his two companions escaped unscathed during an attack by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Cabacnitan, Batuan, Bohol.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Sunstar (Philippines); Philippine News Agency
notes: On 26 November 2019, the military carried out airstrikes in Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao during a so-called surgical operation meant to take out the group of an influential leader of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF). Conflicting reports noted three BIFF fatalities, but these fatalities were also instead said to be from the BIFF-allied Dawlah Islamiyah, who were supposedly hit by artillery fire during military ground operations. The government attack on Dawlah Islamiyah was coded as another event and includes the mentioned three fatalities. Fatalities in this event coded as zero.

notes: On 27 November 2019, an NPA militant was killed while four others escaped during a five-minute firefight with the military in Barangay Kapatagan, Laak, Davao de Oro (Davao de Oro). The military also reported retrieving a pistol and two IEDs.

On 27 November 2019, two police officers of the Philippine National Police Maritime Group were killed while two others were wounded when unidentified assailants, suspected to be smugglers, fired at them during an encounter off Sarangani Bay near Barangay Labangal, General Santos City, South Cotabato.
On 28 November 2019, a former village chief was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Santa Ana, Cagayan.

On 28 November 2019, government forces and suspected NPA militants engaged in a 30-minute firefight in Jabonga, Agusan del Norte. There were no reported casualties on both sides. The military reported retrieving weapons after the clash.

On 28 November 2019, unidentified assailants set fire to the Regional Trial Court Branch 29 building in San Miguel, Zamboanga del Sur. The part of the building set on fire reportedly housed ballot boxes containing votes that are being contested in an electoral protest.

On 28 November 2019, students and faculty members of the University of the Philippines Diliman demonstrated on campus in Diliman, Quezon City to protest alleged irregularities in the selection process for college deans in the state university. [size=no report]

source: Abante; Cebu Daily News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; CNN; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 28 November 2019, a police officer was killed by a grenade explosion while the grenade thrower was killed by another responding police officer during an altercation next to a local office of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) in Barangay Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. The grenade thrower was reportedly demanding that the DENR release his truck, which had earlier been intercepted for supposedly carrying illegally-cut lumber. 16 others, including a DENR employee as well as teachers and students of a college adjoining the DENR office, were wounded in the explosion.
